page.title: 13LEOMINSTER FARMER'S DAY
page.content: The daily routine begins with the feeding of calves, reared initially on powdered milk. The milk taken from the cows is stored in a refrigerated tank to await daily collection by a bulk tanker. The potato crop may develop diseases and spraying by aeroplane or tractor is necessary. Corn crops are also sprayed to prevent weeds and diseases. Some grass is being cut and dried for hay, but more is cut and compressed into silage as a supply of winter food. Many processes on the farm are now mechanised, making reductions in manual labour and fewer workers being required. The price of produce such as beef, lamb, pork, eggs, fruit and potatoes is affected by European Economic Community policies.
